sentence: Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) will begin trading ex-dividend on May 30, 2017.
A cash dividend payment of $0.89 per share is scheduled to be paid on June 15, 2017.
Shareholders who purchased HD prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an 28.99% increase over prior dividend payment.
At the current stock price of $156.46, the dividend yield is 2.28%.
The previous trading day's last sale of HD was $156.46, representing a -2.74% decrease from the 52 week high of $160.86 and a 31.26% increase over the 52 week low of $119.20.
HD is a part of the Consumer Services sector, which includes companies such as Lowe's Companies, Inc. ( LOW ) and Sherwin-Williams Company ( SHW ).
HD's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $6.68.
Zacks Investment Research reports HD's forecasted earnings growth in 2018 as 12.05%, compared to an industry average of 14%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the HD Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.

It also has the highest percent weighting of HD at 7.39%.
